conclusion: The ball of mass m is placed on a smooth vertical ring, connected to a light rope passing through a smooth hole at the top of the ring, making an angle θ with the vertical direction, and is in static equilibrium.
The net force acting on the ball is zero due to static equilibrium.
The forces acting on the ball are gravitational force (mg), tension in the rope (T), and normal force (N).
The ball is positioned on a ring with a rope making an angle θ with the vertical.
The vertical component of the tension is T cosθ, and it balances the gravitational force mg: T cosθ = mg.
The horizontal component of the tension is T sinθ, and it balances the normal force N: N = T sinθ.
The force F at the top of the rope is equal to the tension T in the rope.
Solving for T from the vertical force balance: T = mg/cosθ.
The force F applied at the top of the rope is F = mg/cosθ.
